medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began approximately 18 months prior with a diffuse, pruritic rash that progressed to total-body erythema over the next year. Diagnosis of psoriasis was made, and treatments including topical glucocorticoids and oral cephaloridine were administered without improvement. The rash worsened five months before admission, leading to hospitalization due to fever and leg swelling.
